meanings.definition: Not showing concern or sympathy for others.
meanings.sent1: The uncaring teacher didn't notice when the student was upset.
meanings.sent2: She gave an uncaring shrug when her friend shared the bad news.
meanings.sent3: The uncaring cat ignored its owner's attempts to play with it.
meanings.sent4: The uncaring storm clouds rolled in, oblivious to the picnic below.
meanings.sent5: His uncaring attitude left a trail of hurt feelings in its wake.

meanings.sent1: The uncaring movie left the audience bored and unimpressed.
meanings.sent2: She stared at the uncaring painting, unable to understand its appeal.
meanings.sent3: The uncaring clock seemed to tick slower than usual, mocking his impatience.
meanings.sent4: The uncaring wind blew through the empty streets, carrying whispers of forgotten dreams.
meanings.sent5: His uncaring gaze drifted past her, as if she were invisible.
